skills: Differentiated Instruction, Multiple Intelligences, STEM Education, Problem-Based Learning, Common Core, NGSS, Sheltered Instruction Techniques, English Language Learners (ELL) Support, IEP/504 Plan Modification, Lesson Plan Design & Execution, Lab Development, Assessment Design, Google Applications Training, Professional Development, Curriculum Development, Formative & Summative Assessments, Molecular Diagnostics, DNA Extraction, DNA Quantitation, PCR, Capillary Electrophoresis (CE), Instrument Maintenance & Calibration, Quality Control (QC), Laboratory Procedures, Test Validation, Sample Analysis, Pathology Resident Training, QA/QC Procedure & Protocol Adherence, Equipment Management, Large-Scale Electrophoresis, Seminar Coordination, Technician Training & Competency Assessment (TCA), Continuing Education (TCE) Program Management, State Reporting (Department of Health), Troubleshooting & Investigation, Database Management, Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) Development, Parent/Guardian Communication, Collaboration, Mentorship, Fundraising (DonorsChoose.org), TI Nspire CX graphing calculators, Google Certified Educator (Level 1), Good Laboratory Practices (GLP).
work_experience: The candidate has a diverse professional background spanning education and clinical laboratory management. As a Biology Teacher (11/2016 - Current, and 09/2011 - 11/2016) and Student Teacher (01/2011 - 03/2011), they excelled in developing and implementing lesson plans and labs that incorporated differentiated instruction, STEM, problem-based learning, Common Core, and NGSS. Key educational achievements include providing Google applications training, utilizing Sheltered Instruction for English Language Learners, co-teaching for IEP/504 plans, successfully fundraising for classroom technology, communicating student progress, and achieving Level 1 Google Certified Educator status. In the clinical laboratory field, the candidate served as a Clinical Lab Manager/Technologist (04/2007 - 04/2011), responsible for educating Pathology Residents, researching and validating new laboratory tests, performing molecular studies (DNA extraction/quantitation, PCR, CE), and managing laboratory operations according to QA/QC protocols. As a Quality Control Technician - TCA/E Coordinator (08/2005 - 04/2007), they coordinated seminars, managed technician training and competency programs, handled state reporting, and troubleshot lab processes. Earlier, as a Clinical Laboratory Technician (01/2005 - 08/2005), they were involved in preparing materials for large-scale electrophoresis testing.
